snippet: The House, like the Senate, passed a bill barring representation fees or union dues to obtain a job, but the vote was far from enough to override a veto.
abstract: Missouri's Republican-controlled General Assembly approves legislation that would put right-to-work policy in place; vote falls short of number needed to override likely veto by Gov Jay Nixon.
lead_paragraph: The House, like the Senate, passed a bill barring representation fees or union dues to obtain a job, but the vote was far from enough to override a veto.

headline.main: Missouri Passes Anti-Union Bill, but It Isn’t Veto-Proof
headline.print_headline: Unions Face New Limits in Missouri
